entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is one of the main characters in the story, described as sitting at the back of the Charms class with Ron and Hermione.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is another main character in the story, described as being indignant about Harry's egg clue.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a main character in the story, described as sitting at the back of the Charms class with Harry and Hermione.

entities.name: neville
entities.description: Neville is a student in the Charms class, described as having poor aim.

entities.name: professor flitwick
entities.description: Professor Flitwick is the teacher of the Charms class, described as giving each student a stack of cushions to practice with.

entities.name: egg clue
entities.description: The egg clue is an object that Harry is working on, described as being fine-tuned by him.

entities.name: summoning charm
entities.description: The Summoning Charm is a spell that the students are supposed to be practicing against.

relationships.description: Harry is working on fine-tuning the egg clue, as described in the text: 'He, Ron, and Hermione were sitting at the very back of the Charms class with a table to themselves. They were supposed to be practicing the opposite of the Summoning Charm today — the Banishing Charm... Harry hissed as Professor Flitwick approached.'
Harry is talking to Hermione, as described in the text: 'ou said you’d already worked out that egg clue!” said Hermione indignantly. ‘Keep your voice down!’ said Harry crossly.'
Harry is sitting with Ron, as described in the text: 'He, Ron, and Hermione were sitting at the very back of the Charms class with a table to themselves.'

Neville is hitting Professor Flitwick with an object, as described in the text: 'Neville’s aim was so poor that he kept accidentally sending much heavier things flying across the room — Professor Flitwick, for instance.'

Professor Flitwick is being hit by Neville with an object, as described in the text: 'Neville’s aim was so poor that he kept accidentally sending much heavier things flying across the room — Professor Flitwick, for instance.'
